Package util

Class Util

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.Util

extends java.lang.Object
    Utility library with helper methods to process user inputs.

      • validateDate

        public static boolean validateDate​(java.lang.String dateStr)
        Checks if the date provided as a string is in yyyy-MM-dd format.
        Parameters:
        dateStr - Date as string to be validated.
        Returns:
        True if the string is in yyyy-MM-dd format.

      • validateXml

        public static boolean validateXml​(java.lang.String filePath)
        Checks if a portfolio XML created outside the program is in valid format.
        Parameters:
        filePath - Filepath of the XMl file to be validated.
        Returns:
        True if the XML file is in valid format needed by the program.

      • validateCsv

        public static boolean validateCsv​(java.lang.String filePath)
        Ensures that an uploaded transactions csv file has a valid date, ticker symbol, transaction type, and total value of the transaction.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the file path having the transactions file.
        Returns:
        true if the csv is valid, else returns false.

      • copyFileToSystem

        public static void copyFileToSystem​(java.lang.String username,
                                    java.lang.String filename,
                                    java.lang.String targetFileName)
        Helper method to load external Portfolio XML file to the user's list of portfolios.
        Parameters:
        username - User to whom the portfolio belongs to.
        filename - XMl file of the portfolio.
        targetFileName - the file to be copied.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - when an error occurs when copying the file to program's file storage.

      • isValidStockQuantity

        public static boolean isValidStockQuantity​(java.lang.String str)
        Checks if the string is a valid positive integer.
        Parameters:
        str - String to be validated.
        Returns:
        True if the string is a valid positive integer.

      • compareDates

        public static int compareDates​(java.lang.String date1,
                               java.lang.String date2)
        Compares two dates. Provides a positive number if date1 is greater than date2, a negative number if date1 is lesser than date2 and a zero if they are the same.
        Parameters:
        date1 - The first date to be compared.
        date2 - The second date to be compared.
        Returns:
        positive integer if date1 greater than date2, negative integer if date1 less than date2, a zero if date1 equals date2.

      • getPortfolioTransactions

        public static java.util.List<TransactionItem> getPortfolioTransactions​(java.lang.String username,
                                                                       java.lang.String portfolioName)
        Reading the list of transactions lines from a given flexible portfolio.
        Parameters:
        username - the username associated with the portfolio.
        portfolioName - the portfolio file name for which the transactions need to be fetched.
        Returns:
        a List of TransactionItem objects that each represent a buy/sell/commission action.

      • giveDateRange

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> giveDateRange​(java.lang.String fromDate,
                                                             java.lang.String toDate)
        Provides a date list using the input from-date and to-date. The date list is generated based on the date range. The date list has a size of atleast 5 and a maximum size of 30. An exception is thrown if the from-date is greater than the to date or if the range has less than 5 days in it.
        Parameters:
        fromDate - the from-date.
        toDate - the to-date.
        Returns:
        The list of dates between the fromDate and the current time.

      • getDateListInRangeWithInterval

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getDateListInRangeWithInterval​(java.lang.String fromDate,
                                                                              java.lang.Integer interval,
                                                                              java.lang.String... toDate)
        Provides a date range between a range for a provided interval in days. If the toDate provided is in the future or is not provided at all, then the toDate is assumed to being the current date in "yyyy-mm-dd" format. A date list is returned in accordance to this new date range.
        Parameters:
        fromDate - the from-date in "yyyy-mm-dd" format.
        interval - the number of interval days.
        toDate - an optional to-date in "yyyy-mm-dd" format.
        Returns:
        a list of dates that range from the fromDate to the toDate with an `interval` number of days inbetween consecutive dates in the list.

      • validateWeight

        public static boolean validateWeight​(java.lang.String weight)
        Validates if the weight provided is a valid double value.
        Parameters:
        weight - String representation of the weight.
        Returns:
        true if the weight is within 0-100 range.

      • round

        public static double round​(double value,
                           int places)
        Rounds up the provided double value with the provided precision.
        Parameters:
        value - Double value to round off.
        places - Number of decimal places.
        Returns:
        Decimal number after rounding-off upto the places provided.
